Circulation problems in the feet:* Tobacco smoking* Obesity* Lack of exercise* Improper diet* High blood pressure* High cholesterol* Diabetes* Pregnancy* Long periods of sitting in a cramped and immobile position (Economy Class Syndrome)And vascular disease.Write everything down that is bothering you and discuss each one with the doctor. Be sure to discuss the tests he/she will be ordering and what he/she is looking for. At  minimum get a CBC (complete blood check).

question: i did not know where to post this question but i know that diabetes can cause circulation problems. the last few days i have been noticing that the veins very close to the skin surface have been become very noticeable. it started on the palms of my hands and around my ankles. just this morning i noticed that the veins are more noticeable now on my legs and near the temples of my head. i also have been having a slight tingling feeling in my right leg and sometimes my right hand. i was just wondering if this is a sign of diabetes or something else. i will be going to the doctors at the beginning of next week but just wanted some early info. thanks.
title: sign of diabetes?
